title: Ticket #5479: Allow user to define failure for DAG node jobs
description:
Miron wants users to be able to define (at the DAG level) what constitutes failure for a DAG node job (as opposed to the current semantics that any non-zero exit code is a failure).

The user should be able to specify a ClassAd expression (first globally, then with the capability to override it for individual nodes). (The first step is just hard-coding an expression that matches the current semantics, just to exercise the ClassAd evaluation code within DAGMan.)

One other issue is how this should apply to PRE and POST scripts -- should the same expression apply to them, or do they each need their own expression? My initial thought is that there should just be a single expression that applies to the PRE script, HTCondor job, and POST script.

Also, another question (just syntactic) is whether this should be defined in terms of failure or success.

Part of the motivation for this is to make it explicit if a non-zero exit code constitutes "success", as opposed to "hiding" that semantic in the POST script.
